RyuujinTypes.Name: Midori-ryuu, the Green Dragon
Benedictions: The Tale of the Traveler's Journal

Artefacts.Name: Encyclopedia
Artefacts.Description: You are running the game with rules as written.

Artefacts.Name: Sextant
Artefacts.Description: You have created a few original rules and will be using them.

Artefacts.Name: Torch
Artefacts.Description: Double all experience at the end of each session.

Artefacts.Name: Crystal
Artefacts.Description: PCs can survive damage up to -20 HP; they will not die until their HP reaches -21.

Artefacts.Name: Ring
Artefacts.Description: Indicates all of the PCs are relatives, students, or disciples.

Artefacts.Name: Mascot
Artefacts.Description: The Ryuujin can accompany the travelers in their shapechanged form.

Artefacts.Name: Greatsword
Artefacts.Description: During the battle setup phase, you can include twice as many objects as normal.

Artefacts.Name: Longspear
Artefacts.Description: Indicates ll the PCs are members of an army, and they are traveling in order to fulfill a mission for that army.

Artefacts.Name: Longbow
Artefacts.Description: In battle scenes, initiative is only used for turn order. Instead, before each strike the defender rolls [DEX+INT] to attempt to dodge the attack.

Artefacts.Name: Chalice
Artefacts.Description: Indicates that all of the PCs have a dark past.

Artefacts.Name: Dagger
Artefacts.Description: Once per journey, an NPC can die (no roll required).

Artefacts.Name: Mirror
Artefacts.Description: Any time the PCs experience fear, make a [SPI+SPI] fear check with target number 6. On a failure, a PC gains the Shock: 4 status effect.

Benedictions.Name: The Tale of the Journey
Benedictions.Description: Up to two PCs who roleplay ardently pursuing the goal of the journey can ignore all weather modifiers for the rest of the session.

Benedictions.Name: The Tale of Nostalgia
Benedictions.Description: Up to two PCs who roleplay nostalgia for home can ignore all negative effects of mind-based status effects for the rest of the session.

Benedictions.Name: The Tale of the Traveler's Journal
Benedictions.Description: At the end of the session, up to two PCs who write about their journey in a travel diary will receive their character level x 300 in gold.

Benedictions.Name: The Tale of Kindness
Benedictions.Description: Up to two PCs who help others expecting no gain or reward can raise their spirit score by one level for the rest of the session.

Benedictions.Name: The Tale of Love
Benedictions.Description: Up to two PCs who are in love gain 1 point of armor for the rest of the session.

Benedictions.Name: The Tale of the Heart
Benedictions.Description: Hand out five chips to each player. A player can award a chip to another player who roleplays in a way that moves someone's heart. A player can exchange an awarded chip for a Fumble Point, which can be used immediately.

Benedictions.Name: The Tale of the Hero
Benedictions.Description: Allows a mortally wounded PC to cheat death. If this is used when a PC would have died, all PCs' HP is immediately restored to full. (Can only be used once per session.)

Benedictions.Name: The Tale of the Challenge
Benedictions.Description: Each PC who has a rival or adversary can raise their STR by one die size for the rest of the session.

Benedictions.Name: The Tale of Revival
Benedictions.Description: Any PC who who ends up with negative HP and then heals above 0 can raise one ability score by one step for the rest of the session. (Can only be used once per PC per session.)

Benedictions.Name: The Tale of Revenge
Benedictions.Description: Up to two PCs who act with hatred for the purpose of revenge gain a +1 bonus to any action for the rest of the session.

Benedictions.Name: The Tale of Guidance
Benedictions.Description: A PC who cooperates with another PC can add a +1 bonus to their Condition for the rest of the session.

Benedictions.Name: The Tale of Slaughter
Benedictions.Description: For the rest of the session, any PC who kills a creature or living thing large than 1 meter tall/long regains 2 MP.

Benedictions.Name: Fortune
Benedictions.Description: Before the dice are rolled, make a skill check a critical success.

Benedictions.Name: Misfortune
Benedictions.Description: Before the dice are rolled, make a skill check a fumble.

Benedictions.Name: Elite Enemy
Benedictions.Description: Increase a monster's HP by (level x 3) and make it immune to all status effects (curing any status effects it currently has).

Benedictions.Name: Murder of Crows
Benedictions.Description: Treat a group of creatures of the same type as a single enemy. For every 3 monsters in the mob, increase its Attack and Damage checks by +1 each.

Benedictions.Name: Surprise Attack
Benedictions.Description: The PCs are automatically surprised in combat.

Benedictions.Name: We Meet Again
Benedictions.Description: A single NPC who is supposed to have died returns, no longer dead.

Benedictions.Name: Run Away
Benedictions.Description: A single NPC runs away from the PCs (no check is needed).

Reveils.Name: Guidance of the Dragon
Reveils.Description: If the PCs are lost, change a failed Direction Check into a success.

Reveils.Name: Berth of the Dragon
Reveils.Description: Change a failed Camping Check into a success.

Reveils.Name: Gift of the Dragon
Reveils.Description: You give the party enough food to last them for 3 days of travel.

Reveils.Name: Roar of the Dragon
Reveils.Description: All objects in combat which have been expended become usable once again.

Reveils.Name: Protection of the Dragon
Reveils.Description: When one or more PCs is about to take damage, the Ryuujin jumps in and takes the damage instead, nullifying it.

Reveils.Name: Fury of the Dragon
Reveils.Description: One enemy receives d6 + d6 damage which cannot be avoided or reduced. However, the dragon will not finish the enemy off; if the enemy would be reduced to 0 HP or lower, they instead end up at 1 HP.
